entry.title: CDS Views: The Key to a "Clean Core" and a More Agile SAP
entry.content:
What is a CDS View?

In SAP S/4HANA, a CDS View (Core Data Services) is the modern way to create an intelligent, semantic data layer directly on the SAP HANA database. Think of it as a "super-advanced filter" or a virtual report that organizes and makes information from various tables available in a consistent, standardized, and reusable way.

  • It's a method to centralize and standardize data access, eliminating the need for repetitive and complex code for queries.

  • It serves as a single source of truth, allowing Fiori apps, analytical reports, APIs, and even external integrations to consume the same data consistently.

An Analogy:

Imagine you have a stack of information in different spreadsheets. Instead of manually joining, copying, and pasting data to create a report, you build a CDS View.

This CDS View is a "virtual report" you create just once. In it, you define exactly what data you need from which spreadsheets (tables), how they connect, and how they should be presented (for example, "this column represents a monetary value").

Why are CDS Views Essential in S/4HANA?

  • Unmatched Performance: A CDS View processes data where it lives—on the database, the "filing room." Instead of moving large volumes of data to the "office" (application server), all the logic is executed locally, which is incredibly faster, especially with the power of SAP HANA.

  • Versatility and Reusability: Once you create a CDS View, you can use it for various purposes without replicating your work. The same data view can be used to:

    • Create an analytical chart on a dashboard.

    • Build a mobile app (Fiori).

    • Generate a detailed report for management.

  • Built-in Intelligence: A CDS View goes far beyond just displaying data. It is "intelligent" by nature. Within it, you can embed business rules, such as "show only sales from the last quarter" or "restrict salary viewing to managers only."

The Context: SAP's Evolution to S/4HANA

The creation of CDS Views is directly tied to the evolution of SAP's technology. Before the arrival of SAP HANA, the architecture was traditional: ABAP programs ran on an application server, and data resided on a separate database server.

For any analysis or report, large volumes of data had to be transferred from the database to the application server. This back-and-forth was slow and inefficient, creating a performance bottleneck.

With HANA, everything changed. As an in-memory database, it processes data at extremely high speeds. SAP then adopted the "Code-to-Data" (or "Code Pushdown") philosophy—that is, "pushing" the processing logic to where the data already is: on the database itself.

This is where the CDS View finds its purpose:

  • Overcoming the Past: Old database views were simple and static. CDS Views were created to be an intelligent new data modeling layer that leverages all the capabilities of HANA, such as parallel processing and real-time analytics.

  • Centralizing Logic: They allow developers to define business logic (calculations, filters, aggregations) and access rules directly in the view, centralizing technical knowledge in a single location.

  • Preparing for the Future: CDS Views were SAP's solution to support the new SAP Fiori interface and embedded analytics tools. With semantic annotations, they make it easy to create modern, intuitive applications that understand the meaning of the data.

The Connection to the "Clean Core" Strategy

The CDS View is the central tool that SAP provides to put the Clean Core strategy into practice. The goal of the Clean Core is to keep the S/4HANA system as close as possible to its standard version, avoiding direct modifications to its "core."

Traditionally, companies altered standard code and tables, making future upgrades and innovations very expensive and complex.

CDS Views changed the game. Instead of modifying what already exists, developers create CDS Views to meet specific needs.

  • Extensions Without Complications: Instead of modifying a standard SAP table, you create an extension CDS View, adding fields or logic without touching the original object.

  • Abstraction and Protection: CDS Views act as an abstraction layer. Your application only communicates with the view, not with the standard table. This means that if the underlying table structure changes in a future upgrade, your application won't be affected because the CDS View can be adjusted to absorb the change.

  • Smoother Upgrades: Because customizations are in separate objects (the CDS Views), the process of upgrading to a new S/4HANA version becomes much safer and faster, without the risk of code conflicts.

  • Centralized Consistency: By centralizing business logic in CDS Views, you prevent code duplication and ensure that rules are applied consistently throughout the system.

The Clean Core is a strategy that aims to keep the SAP S/4HANA system as close as possible to its original standard. Historically, companies customized SAP by altering core tables and programs, which made upgrades complex, slow, and expensive.

CDS Views emerged as the ideal tool to solve this problem. They allow you to add your business logic and customizations without modifying SAP's standard code.

Usefull Links:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/c0c54048d35849128be8e872df5bea6d/5418de55938d1d22e10000000a44147b.html

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/code-to-data-paradigm-in-abap-with-sap-hana/ba-p/13428352

entry.title: Stay up-to-date on your SAP Cloud services and system status with timely notifications
entry.content:
Are you interested in receiving timely communication about your SAP Cloud Services and system availability? This blog post will guide you through the process of getting notified about system status updates, planned and unplanned maintenance, service disruptions, and more. 

 
These notifications come from the SAP Cloud Availability application maintained within SAP for Me. To better understand this feature and explore its functionalities, I encourage you to check these meaningful contents:  
 
All you need to know about SAP Cloud Availability
2548400 - Getting started with the SAP  Cloud  Availability - SAP for Me 
 
 
Now, let’s get you set up to receive the alerts.   
 
SAP Cloud Notification subscriptions – Get Notified 

First, you should consider there are two available options to subscribe for SAP Cloud Notifications. They can be added and managed either by yourself or by your company’s Super or Cloud Administrators.  
 
Please Note:  
Previously, some cloud subscription options did not require an S-user ID. When these subscriptions were migrated to the cloud notification application, non-users were also migrated.  Individuals that have subscribed for cloud notifications without having an S-user ID must contact their Super or Cloud Administrators to manage the subscriptions on their behalf.  

Administrators can manage the subscriptions for non S-user contacts from the same application as for S-user IDs. The ‘User Type’ filter can be a helpful tool to quickly distinguish between both scenarios. Below you'll find the steps and documentation reference for this. 
 
 
Subscribing your own S-user ID for Cloud Notifications 

Ensure your S-User ID is assigned with one of the authorizations below:   

  • Display System Data.   
  • Edit System Data.   

 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab. 
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. 
  3. Select ‘Add New Subscription’. 

  4. A pop-up window will enable you to select your subscription preferences.  
  5. Click ‘Save’ to reflect your elections.  

Your subscription will now be added and can be managed directly from the Get Notified tab.  
 

To adjust your notification preferences or unsubscribe from an existing one, simply locate the subscription through ‘My Subscriptions’ and click on the corresponding icon based on the desired action (Pencil icon = edit / Trash can icon = delete).

Check the following SAP Knowledge Base Article for additional reference on this process: 2900069 - How S-users manage their own Cloud Notification subscriptions - SAP for Me.  

 

Adding Cloud Notifications for other S-user IDs as a Super or Cloud Administrator 

  1. In the Systems & Provisioning dashboard in SAP for Me, go to the Get Notified tab.  
  2. The 'My Subscriptions' will appear by default. Switch to ‘Manage Subscriptions’.  
  3. Select ‘Add New Subscription’.    
  4. In the pop-up window, enter the subscription options and the S-user(s) to get notified via the ‘Contacts’ field.
     
  5. Save the subscription selection.  

Once completed, Administrators can manage the subscriptions from the same application by locating it and selecting the relevant action. Options include adding subscriber, editing or deleting the subscription.   

Further guidance is available in the article 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users - SAP for Me.  
 

Support Resources 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, you can always refer to the following support options: 

  • Create a Support Case: For any technical issues related to the Get Notified application, create a case selecting ‘SAP for ME’ and ‘Systems & Provisioning > Get Notified’ under product related fields. Follow the steps from SAP Knowledge Base Article  1296527 for further guidance.  
     
  • SAP Customer Interaction Center: For navigation or initial troubleshooting assistance, feel free to reach out to the Customer Interaction Center team: Contact Customer Interaction Center. 
     

Thank you for reading! We hope you found this helpful and would love to hear your thoughts about this blog post. Let us know what you think!   
  
Stay tuned for our upcoming Support Webinars and recorded sessions to continuously learn and get the best from SAP Support:  Register Now  
 

Read more #CustomerInteractionCenter blog posts here!

entry.title: SAP BTP for HR at SAP Connect and Success Connect 2025 summary - bigger and better than ever
entry.content:
Come see SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) at this year’s SAP Connect / Success Connect event in Las Vegas! Due to the ever-increasing interest in SAP BTP topics and our sessions in prior years having standing-room only attendance, SAP BTP has more sessions than ever before! We even have for the first time ever, not one, but two hands-on-labs!

SAP BTP topics for 2025

This year’s SAP BTP for HR experience at SAP Connect is all about more. More business scenarios, more technology, more platform - more BTP! This year’s topics include customer favorites such as integration, extensibility and automation as well as numerous SAP SuccessFactors product-led sessions about how SAP BTP helps them deliver better solutions making it easier for customers to streamline HCM processes. Additionally, as we see an increase in technical audience members, we’ll be featuring slightly more
technical product deep dives by the product teams (also a first for us!).

Demos and hands-on labs

Demo-station demo: Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding, featuring Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh

We’re showcasing two demos at the “Integration and Extension with SAP BTP” demo station. The first is our popular Automate new hire equipment ordering during onboarding demo which shows SAP Integration Suite’s Advanced Event Mesh event-driven integration capabilities to provide automated equipment ordering. This dramatically reduces the amount of time a people manager spends ordering equipment as well as requesting access to systems and data. If you missed this demo in Lisbon last year, then this is your chance!  Included are:

  • See how we used SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to analyze onboarding processes to identify key areas to address inefficiencies: hiring manager ordering of equipment, waiting for responses from people via email
  • SAP Integration Suite and advanced event mesh which offers real-time triggering of data synchronization based on SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central event triggers
  • An example app an IT department can create to offer pre-bundled packages of equipment to make it easier for managers to pick equipment, and to standardize offerings
  • One-click approvals by the hiring manager, powered by SAP Build 
  • Automatically submitting equipment selection to SAP Ariba guided buying via SAP Integration Suite
  • Notifications pushed to the task center for the hiring manager via SAP Build
  • Automatic submission of support tickets to SAP Service Cloud for manual tasks like requesting access to systems and data


Demo-station demo: Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo and hands-on lab

Additionally, we’re showing our brand new Create a mobile app with SAP Build demo which is specifically designed for more technical HRIS audiences in collaboration with the SAP SuccessFactors team. 

This demo is also the basis of two, 75-minute hands-on labs we’re offering this year which are sure to sell out! The lab will walk non-technical novices and intermediate technical knowledge people (non-developers, IT and HRIS are our target audience) on how to use SAP Build to quickly and easily create a mobile app with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central people data to offer location-specific benefits for a field office – all with no coding, using SAP Build’s powerful drag-and-drop development interface. We’ll have product experts from the SAP Build team presenting and explaining to the audience the different capabilities of SAP Build in a follow-the-presenter format from their own workstations in live SAP Build environments so everyone will be able to walk away with direct product knowledge of what’s possible.
Included in the session:

  • Overview of the low-code SAP Build environment
  • Overview of various content types, controls, functions available
  • Adding content and configuring to the controls
  • Using an integration to SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central for people data
  • Accessing benefits information in the employee profile via API
  • Customizing the look and feel of the app
  • Testing the app and deployment

View the hands-on lab in the event catalog: Hands-on lab: Creating a custom mobile app for HR using SAP Build solutions (limited capacity) | HCM1677

There’s also quick overview videos of both these demos on the SAP.com/btp-for-HR page as well!

 

SAP BTP-led sessions

Integration sessions


Maximizing HCM process efficiency with integration through SAP BTP | HCM1665

Discover how SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Integration Suite enable integrations for SAP SuccessFactors HCM, automating tasks and processes. Explore third-party integration use cases, such as recruiting, onboarding, and data collection, and strategies for connecting hybrid landscapes, including legacy on-premises and third-party systems as well as event-driven integrations.

How to use event-driven integration to collaborate in real time | HCM1682

Explore how SAP Integration Suite advanced event mesh can use business events from SAP SuccessFactors solutions such as SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to push data to other internal or external systems in real-time. See firsthand how you can use this capability to trigger immediate actions, such as when an employee is hired or terminated.



Application development and extensibility sessions

Increasing employee efficiency with automation capabilities in SAP BTP | HCM1671

Explore automation capabilities in SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) that can streamline your HCM processes. From recruiting and onboarding to document management, SAP BTP can help you reduce errors in manual data entry and make your employees happier by reducing repetitive and mundane tasks through automation and workflows.

Using SAP Build to extend your SAP SuccessFactors solutions | HCM1463

Standardized business processes have come a long way, but every company still has a few things it does differently from everybody else. SAP Build solutions can help extend your human capital management solutions to address your specific business needs. See firsthand how to create low-code/no-code apps that boost end-user adoption and efficiency.

 

SAP SuccessFactors-led technology sessions including SAP BTP


These SAP SuccessFactors product expert-led sessions discuss how SAP BTP solutions help SAP SuccessFactors deliver better solutions to our customers as well as ways customers may not be aware of how they can use SAP BTP today with their existing SAP SuccessFactors solutions.

 

AI Technology, use cases and innovation

Road map and vision: AI in SAP SuccessFactors HCM | HCM1451

Look at SAP’s AI strategy and planned AI innovations in SAP SuccessFactors HCM. See what’s on the AI road map for HCM and get insights into SAP’s responsible, real-world AI approach. AI-driven capabilities such as the Joule copilot, AI agents, and the mobile experience with Joule  enhance employee experience, adaptability, and productivity

Unlocking and extending the Joule copilot with Joule Studio | HCM1571

Experience how Joule Studio allows you to create and deploy custom Joule agents and skills that improve efficiency across SAP and third-party systems and enhance your HR experience. Learn about prerequisites and how to get started, and find out how the agent builder capability in Joule Studio can empower you to create your own intelligent agents.

Everything you need to know about AI agents for HCM | HCM1468

AI agents are "smart teammates" that can observe, plan, and act, often without human intervention. Get a first look at some of the Joule Agents in the HCM road map, such as those for performance and goals, HR service, and people intelligence. Learn how agents can automate complex workflows, augment human capabilities, and drive efficiency.

 

 

Employee experience via integration and extensibility

Drive productivity by integrating and extending your HCM solutions | HCM1081

Discover how our recent innovations around integration and extension can help transform your business operations and enhance the user experience. You can use these technologies to integrate and extend your SAP SuccessFactors HCM portfolio with SAP Business Technology Platform.

Enhancing people profiles with SAP Business Technology Platform | HCM1520

See firsthand how you can enhance the latest people profile using SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), with an exclusive preview of advanced features slated for early adopter release in the second half of 2025. Learn how to extend people profiles to meet your organization’s needs and boost the user experience.

Drive productivity by integrating and extending your HCM solutions | HCM1081

Discover how our recent innovations around integration and extension can help transform your business operations and enhance the user experience. You can use these technologies to integrate and extend your SAP SuccessFactors HCM portfolio with SAP Business Technology Platform.

 

Technology and administration


Road map and vision: Application and technology foundation | HCM1030

Explore the latest innovations and enhancements in the technology and application foundation of SAP SuccessFactors solutions, including the SAP Business Data Cloud solution, Joule Studio, security, integration, extensibility through SAP Build solutions, and more. See demos and gain insights into what we have planned for our upcoming releases.

Simplifying your system administration to maximize business continuity | HCM1106

Explore innovative solutions to streamline system configuration and administration of your SAP SuccessFactors solutions. Gain practical tips on how your organization can modernize infrastructure management and boost efficiency with powerful administrative capabilities.

Fortifying together: Best practices for partner and customer security | HCM1061

Explore collaboration strategies and best practices for bolstering security across partners and customers. Discover how collective efforts and aligned practices can mitigate risks and build resilient ecosystems. Don't miss this opportunity to strengthen your security framework and foster trust among your business network.

 

If you haven’t attended Success Connect in the past (now SAP Connect), this year is the time to come to see all the great BTP content and sessions! Learn more about SAP Connect on the event page.

entry.title: 2H 2025 Onboarding (Preview): Employee‑Initiated Corrections to Form I‑9 Section 1
entry.content:
With an upcoming release, we’re introducing a new, employee‑initiated Section 1 Correction flow in SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding (Form I‑9). This capability lets a new hire securely correct mistakes in Section 1—and re‑attest—without restarting onboarding or relying on ad‑hoc admin work.

Disclaimer: Forward‑looking statements. Scope and timing may change before General Availability (GA). This post is for informational purposes only and is not legal advice.

What’s changing

  • New self‑service flow for new hires to request and complete a correction to Section 1.

  • Re‑attestation and e‑signature are captured as part of the correction.

  • Version history & audit preserve a full trail.

  • As a separate but related change, we are also removing the "Validate & Save" button from Form I-9.
    • Why is this being removed? This button doesn't actually "Save" a draft version of the Form I-9 at any point, as we do not want to inadvertently expose sensitive, personally identifiable information. "Validation" is also provided built-in to the page as well, as Onboarding does not permit an employee or HR Users to advance to eSignature without providing a valid set of documents and related information.

Why it matters

  • Keeps accountability for Section 1 with the employee, per program guidance.

  • Reduces manual reopening and support tickets for HR teams.

  • Ensures downstream systems (including E‑Verify, if used) receive corrected data.

  • Improves auditability and compliance posture during internal/external reviews.

How it works (high‑level)

The new "Correct Personal Data" button on Form I-9 Section 1 in the lower right-hand corner

  1. The new hire (employee) now may start a correction from the Form I-9 Section 1. They provide a Reason for why this is being initiated.

  2. Once started, they are redirected back to the Personal Data Collection step to modify or correct any data as desired.

  3. Submit the changes. Onboarding now advances them back to the New Hire Checklist, and from here to the corrected/modified Form I-9 Section 1.

  4. Reviewing and attesting to the corrected information is completed by the employee, who then provides their eSignature.

Note: HR cannot change Section 1 on behalf of the employee in this flow. Corrections remain employee‑initiated.

Note: New Hires can re-initiate the Correction process again here; the Notification itself will only send when the Form I-9 Section 1 is completed, so as to avoid allowing the New Hire to send dozens of Correction Notifications to HR User.

Configuration & controls

  • This is a universal feature that will be enabled for all customers.

    • Why is this set up as universal? We expect this will drive efficiencies for our HR Users and Hiring Managers are New Hires/employees now have the opportunity to self-correct their own data, rather than being reliant on HR Users and Hiring Managers to initiate a correction or restart Onboarding entirely.

  • Eligibility window (for example, until Section 2 is complete, or until an E‑Verify case is created).

  • Notifications & templates for HR Users and Hiring Managers that such a change has been made.

  • Reporting/Audit: version history with old/new values, attestation, signature, timestamp, and reason code.

What this feature doesn’t change

  • Does not reopen Section 2 automatically, nor alter reverification schedules.

  • Does not allow HR to directly edit an employee’s Section 1 within this flow.

Availability

This is presently targeted for availability with the 1H 2026 Release first in our Preview,  and then Production tenants . Please check our updated What's New Viewer, as well as our updated Implementation Guide for further details.

Please note, this feature is not available for Onboarding 1.0.

We would strongly encourage you to test this feature functionality in October 2026 with the upcoming Preview Release! Please ensure you mark any bugs, defects, or actionable feedback you want to provide the Cloud Product Support team with a Subject of: "1H 2026 Form I-9 New Hire Restart Issue:" to ensure this is received and reviewed appropriately. Thank you

This blog reflects product direction at the time of writing and may change without notice. Always consult your legal counsel for compliance matters.

entry.title: Re: Managed RAP Application for Billing Document Header and Item Tables
entry.content:
Thanks for sharing, but isn't this just a "flight scenario" with a different name? What's special about it?

There are numerous examples of simple scenarios out there: in documentation, tutorials, other posts here and even on LI. Sure, might as well add 1001st example on top of 1000, but I'm struggling to understand why... If I decided to share a boilerplate example, I would've at least added more explanation of different parts and why something is done in certain way. So that others could learn from what I've learned and not just follow steps blindly.

By the way, for the actual billing documents (VBRK/VBRP table) there is a standard API in S4: https://api.sap.com/api/API_BILLING_DOCUMENT_SRV/overview

And there is the whole Community page on RAP with links to tutorials and free training in "Getting Started" section: https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/abap/rap 

It also has a link to RAP developer guide, which I highly recommend bookmarking: https://help.sap.com/docs/abap-cloud/abap-rap/abap-restful-application-programming-model?version=sap_btp

entry.title: Re: Default values in SAP SAC Excel Add-IN while publishi...
entry.content:
It actually is context based. Data source was not part of the excel sheet. Before the changes were moved to production tenant, whenever manual posting were done, they were posted to Unassigned data source. After the changes were moved to production tenant, entries were posted in the model with data source as COPY_FROM_LABOR. Hence, when there is a manual adjustment, data is automatically posted to the respective data sources. Hence closing the case.

Thanks,

PS

@ivan_kalcha 
Hey Kalcha,

My scenary I have compositon(Parent-Child).
Try this example:
@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [{
entity: {
       name: 'ZCDS_PP_ORDEM_VH',
      element: 'OrderID'
},
additionalBinding: [{
        localElement: '_Root.Centro',
       element: 'Plant',
       usage: #FILTER
}]
}]
Where _Root.Centro you can fill your "Parent.Field"

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
I have to add my frustration to this change as well.  In fact I was just on with SAP CIC regarding this issue and I was directed to this blog to share my dissatisfaction.

As a partner whose gone through some M&A activity we have a dozen active S-ID's (one for each corporate entity) that we must routinely log in to all of them to pull a consolidated view across our entire company.  It's taken SAP over 4 years now and they still don't have all accounts merged into a single account so multiple log in's everytime I do something is the norm.  This doesn't include the hundreds of client systems we need access to as well.

While the Universal ID wasn't perfect, it worked reasonably well.   The "NEW" Solution promises to be better (log in once and move from S-ID to S-ID without logging out.....Excellent!) but SAP disabling the old when the new isn't ready is a real head scratcher.

If we as a partner deployed our customer this way SAP would be all over us for poorly managing the deployment and negatively impacting our clients.  Why isn't the same expectation made by SAP to their own projects?

Can someone from SAP please explain why the old system can't be left in place until the new one is production ready?

entry.title: Re: Cycle counter using AUoM has +/-'ve negated adjustmen...
entry.content:
Hello,

If the booked qty is in BUoM and Counted qty is AUoM( SUom or PUoM), system will always create +/- entries and SAP always records this as difference in system. User should always Book inventory counting in AUoM( PAC in your case) or BUoM. To always have booking and counting in AUoM( PAC), use BAdI /SCWM/EX_CORE_RMS_OPUNIT or use Preferred UOM( with some exception) to influence Operative UOM during PI process.

Reference- 3273494 - FAQ: Physical inventory in EWM

Br

Shailesh

entry.title: Re: Real Estate Contract management: How to maintain Notes
entry.content:
Hello @munipkumar 

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition Contract and Lease Management / RE-FX, contract notes or memos can only be updated through released APIs. Classic long-text function modules like READ_TEXT/SAVE_TEXT are not allowed in ABAP Cloud. Consequently, your available options are:e.

Use the Real Estate Contracts OData V4 API
Check the service API_REAL_ESTATE_CONTRACT. If your tenant’s version includes a text/memo sub-node in the service metadata, you can POST or PATCH that entity from your ABAP Cloud logic using a Service Consumption Model, or from an external client. This is the standard method for programmatically writing notes contracts. SAP Help Portal

If the note or memo entity isn't exposed in your release, you won’t be able to write long text from on-stack ABAP because there's no released API. Instead, use one of these supported patterns:

Attachments API (A2X API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV) allows uploading text, HTML, or PDF notes and associating them with the contract. This feature is fully supported in Public Cloud. SAP Help Portal

Create a long-text custom field for a Custom Business Object (CBO), if the Real Estate Fiori app allows extensibility, or store notes in a CBO identified by the Contract UUID. Then, display this information through your own RAP UI. This approach is advised as a fallback if the standard API does not provide access to notes. SAP Extensibility Explorer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Place the logic where necessary. If validation or auto-creation of a note is needed during contract processing, use Custom Logic (BAdIs for CLM) and invoke the API within ABAP Cloud using an HTTP destination and service proxy. SAP Support Portal-3579041 - Contract and Lease Management: BAdIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

Practical steps

Open the Help Portal, navigate to Real Estate Contracts (API_REAL_ESTATE_CONTRACT), and review $metadata for a text/memo entity or navigation. If identified, proceed with writing through the service proxy. SAP Help Portal

If it's not available, switch to using the Attachments API by creating a Notes attachment type, or add a CBO plus an extension field on the contract UI if possible.

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

Thank you for your feedback and follow up,

Understood, that UI behaviour is logical.You only see Properties because the field is a standard element. The Expression tab is available only for a Calculated element. In Custom CDS Views, use Add and then select Calculation.

Aggregation appears in Element Properties only for numeric measure fields in analytical views. Mark the field as a measure and choose a Default Aggregation. The effect is visible when using the view, such as in Custom Analytical Queries, not in the preview.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales orders
entry.content: Check the Rounding Rule setting. Change it to "D" (round down) or equivalent to truncate fractions. If "D" is not available, use "X" but with a custom routine or check for Japan-specific settings.

entry.title: Re: Upcoming Deprecation of VBScript, its Impact on SAP GUI Scripting and Resulting Strategy
entry.content:
Hello @Torsten_Hambsch,

here a working example:

# Begin-----------------------------------------------------------------

."$PSScriptRoot\COM.ps1"

Function Main {

  $SapGuiAuto = Get-Object( , "SAPGUI")
  If ($SapGuiAuto -isnot [System.__ComObject]) {
    Return
  }

  $application = Invoke-Method $SapGuiAuto "GetScriptingEngine"
  If ($application -isnot [System.__ComObject]) {
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  Set-Property -object $application -propertyName "HistoryEnabled" `
    -propertyValue $False
  $connection = Get-Property $application "Children" @(0)
  If ($connection -eq $Null) {
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  $DisabledByServer = Get-Property $connection "DisabledByServer"
  If ($True -eq $DisabledByServer) {
    Return
  }

  $session = Get-Property $connection "Children" @(0)
  If ($session -eq $Null) {
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }

  $Busy = Get-Property $session "Busy"
  If ($True -eq $Busy) {
    Free-Object -object $session
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return;
  }

  $Info = Get-Property $session "Info"
  $IsLowSpeedConnection = Get-Property $Info "IsLowSpeedConnection"
  If ($True -eq $IsLowSpeedConnection) {
    Free-Object -object $session
    Free-Object -object $connection
    Free-Object -object $application
    Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto
    Return
  }



  Set-Property -object $application -propertyName "HistoryEnabled" `
    -propertyValue @($True)
  Free-Object -object $session
  Free-Object -object $connection
  Free-Object -object $application
  Free-Object -object $SapGuiAuto

}

# Main
Main

# End-------------------------------------------------------------------

I tried it on Windows 11 with SAP GUI 8.00 PL 14 and PowerShell Windows 5.1 (all x64) and it works as expected.

The MSScriptControl is only available on x86, so it can't work with x64. I don't recommend anyone to work with that anymore, it's extremely outdated and deprecated.

I don't have the slightest idea why it doesn't work for you. Try the example above.

Best regards
Stefan

entry.title: What's New for Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud-2508
entry.content:
Hi Community,

Here is a blog post of What's New features introduced in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 edition in the exciting world of SAP Joule.

New use cases now supported

Joule now enables you to view business data of many SAP objects like Process order , Solution order, Enterprise project , Inspection methods , Work Centers and many more...

Update Delivery Date for Purchase Orders

Joule enables you, as a purchaser, to update delivery dates for purchase orders.

For example, when suppliers or equivalent sources inform you of delays or changes, you can use Joule to update the delivery dates with the new information.

Checking sales order fulfillment status

Joule allows you to check whether a sales order's fulfillment is on track and identify the issues that block its fulfillment. For each sales order, Joule can tell whether such issues exist in the order processing phase. If yes, you can display issue details, view possible causes and handling suggestions for each issue, and navigate to related apps.

Expiring Prices Handling

Joule now enables you to manage expiring prices (stored as condition records for pricing in sales) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. With Joule, you can fetch prices that will expire soon, extend their valid-to dates, and adjust their condition amounts or ratios as you need.

Electronic Document Error Explanations

The Manage Electronic Documents app now enables natural language interaction with Joule, making it easier to understand electronic document exchange errors. You can ask Joule for error explanations and recommended resolution steps. By providing detailed insights, SAP Joule helps you understand the root cause of errors and offers guidance on corrective actions.

There are many more features which can be explored by clicking on the What's New Viewer link https://help.sap.com/docs/joule/capabilities-guide/what-s-new-for-joule-capabilities

Thanks!!!

Explore the SAP Business AI features with SAP Joule.

Regards

Shubham

Joule SAP Business AI SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: Self Service Procure cookbook doesn't describe how th...
entry.content:
Hi @Robson1 

Thank you for your question.

To make the Employee Catalog visible in your My Purchase Requisitions New app within SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you must assign several organizations and you muse ensure user roles are configured. This is a common challenge and relates largely to catalog assignment, user default settings and organizational structure.

Here are steps you should take to achieve Employee Catalog visibility

  1. First thing is to use the Default Settings for User Procurement Fiori app to assign catalogs to your user account. When you have properly assigned it, the catalog becomes visible in the Purchase Requisition app for the user.
  2. Ensure the employee is correctly set up in the organization via TCodes PA30 and PPOMA, or the equivalent public cloud apps. Ensure you assign the correct attributes such as CATALOG at the org unit or position, which should flow to the user’s default catalog assignment. Make sure you confirm that data correctly propagates into the table USER_CATALOGS, this mapping is crucial for your catalog visibility.
  3. The user must have the correct business roles assigned such as Employee Procurement and related catalog access. In some cases, missing authorizations or catalog assignments in business roles can prevent catalogs from displaying for the user.
  4. Make sure the catalog definition for Employee Catalog is active and included in the necessary scope items for example, 18J Self-Service Procurement. Please note that internal or external Catalogs must be enabled or configured either through customizing or via business configuration in the cloud.

If after doing that, the catalogs still do not appear, here are steps to troubleshoot the error

  • Ensure you manually update the USER_CATALOGS table via support tools or check if the attribute propagation from PPOMA or your org structure is correct.
  • Sometimes the catalog visibility issues you experience are caused by missing default settings or propagation glitches in organizational setup. So, double check your configuration and security/authorization assignments.

The Employee Catalog should show in your requisition app once these assignments and settings are correctly completed.

Here are some references to provide further details.

My Purchase Requisitions

SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library


I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Learning Conferences: Ein umfassender Überblick und Highlights 2025
entry.content:
SAP Learning Conferences bieten eine hervorragende Plattform, um die neuesten SAP-Themen zu erkunden, Einblicke von Branchenexperten zu gewinnen und sich mit Fachkollegen zu vernetzen. 

Wichtige Highlights der SAP Learning Conferences 2025

Teilnehmer können durch den Besuch dieser Veranstaltungen Ihr SAP Wissen gezielt erweitern. Zusätzlich können Teilnehmer 25% auf ihre nächste SAP-Zertifizierung sparen, indem sie sich für eine SAP Learning Conference registrieren.*

Hinweis: Dies ist ein zeitlich begrenztes Angebot und ein aktueller ÜBerblick. Eine frühzeitige Anmeldung wird empfohlen, um Ihren Platz zu sichern.

SAP Security Forum / Deutsche Ausgabe

Mit zunehmenden regulatorischen Anforderungen und dem Bedarf, geschäftskritische SaaS-Plattformen abzusichern, stehen IT-Sicherheitsteams vor erheblichen Herausforderungen. Doch welche Schlüsselthemen müssen Unternehmen angehen, um die SAP-Sicherheit in der Zukunft zu gewährleisten? 

Dieses Forum bietet die Möglichkeit, Ihr Fachwissen im Bereich SAP-Sicherheit durch praxisnahe Präsentationen zu Themen wie:
• IT-Cybersicherheitstrends
• Infrastruktur- und Kommunikationssicherheit
• Identitäts- und Zugriffsmanagement
• Compliance und Datenschutz

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 26.–27. November 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Security Forum / German Edition hier buchen

SAP Integration Suite Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Die SAP Integration Suite ist eine Integration-Platform-as-a-Service (iPaaS), die entwickelt wurde, um die Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Prozessen, Diensten, Anwendungen, Events und Daten zu optimieren.

Bei diesem Forum werden die Teilnehmer:
• Die wichtigsten Funktionen und praktischen Anwendungsfälle der SAP Integration Suite erkunden.
• Über die nahtlose Integration von On-Premise- und Cloud-basierten Anwendungen mit SAP-Tools und vorkonfigurierten Inhalten lernen.

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum: 15.–16. Oktober 2025
• Ort: Walldorf, Deutschland

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Integration Suite Forum hier buchen 

SAP Data and Analytics Forum (Deutsche Ausgabe)

Dieses Forum bietet Einblicke in die neuesten Entwicklungen und Trends im Bereich SAP Data and Analytics. Teilnehmer können ihr Wissen durch Expertensitzungen vertiefen und von Erfolgsgeschichten der Kunden lernen. Der erste Tag des Forums ist kostenlos und virtuell, der zweite ist kostenpflichtig und hybrid.

Veranstaltungsstruktur:

Tag 1 (Kostenlos):
Erkunden Sie die neuesten Trends und Entwicklungen in Data and Analytics, einschließlich Best Practices, neuer Technologien und Anwendungen im Zusammenhang mit der SAP Business Data Cloud. Buchen Sie hier die kostenlose Veranstaltung WDVDAF

Tag 2 (Kostenpflichtig):
Nehmen Sie an Expertensitzungen teil, um Ihr Verständnis von SAP Data and Analytics zu verbessern. Tauschen Sie sich mit SAP-Experten, Trainern und anderen Teilnehmern aus. Buchen Sie hier die Veranstaltung in Walldorf ODER virtuell (WDCDAF)

Veranstaltungsdetails:
• Datum:
o 18. November 2025 (Kostenloser virtueller erster Tag)
o 18.–19. November 2025 (Hybridformat, zweiter Tag kostenpflichtig)

Rabatt für DSAG-Mitglieder: DSAG-Mitglieder können 10% sparen, indem sie beim Ticketkauf den Code DSAGDISC25 verwenden. Bitte beachten Sie, dass dieser Rabatt nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden kann.

SAP Data und Analytics Forum, 18.-19. November 2025 (2 Tage, hybride Durchführung, der zweite Tag ist kostenpflichtig)

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel 1.1.2026 | SAP Training

Diese Veranstaltung bietet einen Überblick über die gesetzlichen Änderungen, die ab dem 1. Januar 2026 die Lohn- und Gehaltsabrechnung in Deutschland betreffen. Die Teilnehmer erfahren mehr über die Reformen, neuen Vorschriften und deren Auswirkungen auf die Abrechnungsprozesse.

Für wen ist diese Veranstaltung geeignet:
• Projektteammitglieder
• Mitarbeiter in der Lohnbuchhaltung
• Erfahrene Berater

Veranstaltungsdetails:
Teilnehmer können zwischen zwei identischen Terminen wählen:
• Präsenzveranstaltung: Donnerstag, 4. Dezember 2025, in St. Leon-Rot
• Virtuelle Veranstaltung: Dienstag, 9. Dezember 2025

Hinweis: Diese Veranstaltung ist nicht für den 25% SAP-Zertifizierungsrabatt qualifiziert.

WDEHR4 - Informationen aus der Personalabrechnung DE zum Jahreswechsel hier buchen

Zusätzliche Hinweise

• Der 25% Rabatt auf SAP-Zertifizierungen gilt nur für SAP Learning Conferences und schließt die WDEHR4-Veranstaltung aus.
• DSAG-Mitgliedschaftsrabatte sind für ausgewählte Foren verfügbar, können jedoch nicht mit anderen Angeboten kombiniert werden.

entry.title: Root Casues that no Metrics in AI Core Execution and Model are availabile.
entry.content:
Hi,
I follow this developer tutorial: "Generate Metrics and Compare Models in SAP AI Core".
(https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/ai-core-metrics.html)

The code has been adjusted following the instructiond of the tutorial and the respective Configuration is Completing an Execution and generating a Model. But in the Execution the Metric Resource remains empty Metrics, Custom Metrics and Tags won't get listed but the Execution runs successful trough...

Has someone an idea what could be the root cause why the following code snipets in my main.py won't work?

import os
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
from sklearn.model_selection import KFold, train_test_split
from sklearn.inspection import permutation_importance
from datetime import datetime
import pandas as pd
from ai_core_sdk.models import Metric, MetricTag, MetricCustomInfo, MetricLabel
#
# Logging Metrics: SAP AI Core connection (Step 2)
from ai_core_sdk.tracking import Tracking
aic_connection = Tracking()

# Variables
DATA_PATH = '/app/data/train.csv'
DT_MAX_DEPTH = int(os.getenv('DT_MAX_DEPTH'))
MODEL_PATH = '/app/model/model.pkl'
#
# Load Datasets
df = pd.read_csv(DATA_PATH)
X = df.drop('target', axis=1)
y = df['target']
#
# Metric Logging: Basic (Step 3)
# from ai_core_sdk.models import Metric
aic_connection.log_metrics(
    metrics = [
        Metric(
            name= "N_observations", 
            value= float(df.shape[0]), 
            timestamp=datetime.now().utcnow())
    ]
)
#
# Partition into Train and test dataset
train_x, test_x, train_y, test_y = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.3)
#
# K-fold
kf = KFold(n_splits=5, random_state=31, shuffle=True)
i = 0 # storing step count
for train_index, val_index in kf.split(train_x):
    i += 1
    # Train model on subset
    clf = DecisionTreeRegressor(max_depth=DT_MAX_DEPTH, random_state=31)
    clf.fit(train_x.iloc[train_index], train_y.iloc[train_index])
    # Score on validation data (hold-out dataset)
    val_step_r2 = clf.score(train_x.iloc[val_index], train_y.iloc[val_index])
    # Metric Logging: Step Information (Step 4)
    aic_connection.log_metrics(
        metrics = [
            Metric(name= "(Val) Fold R2", value= float(val_step_r2), timestamp=datetime.utcnow(), step=i),
        ]
    )
    # Delete step model
    del(clf)
#
# Final Model
clf = DecisionTreeRegressor(max_depth=DT_MAX_DEPTH, random_state=31)
clf.fit(train_x, train_y)
# Scoring over test data
test_r2_score = clf.score(test_x, test_y)
# Metric Logging: Attaching to metrics to generated model (Step 5)
aic_connection.log_metrics(
    metrics = [
        Metric(
            name= "Test data R2",
            value= float(test_r2_score),
            timestamp=datetime.now().utcnow(),
            labels= [
                MetricLabel(name="metrics.ai.sap.com/Artifact.name", value="housemodel")
            ]
        )
    ]
)
#
# Model Explaination
r = permutation_importance(
    clf, test_x, test_y,
    n_repeats=30,
    random_state=0
)
# Feature importances
feature_importances = str('')
for i in r.importances_mean.argsort()[::-1]:
    feature_importances += f"{df.columns[i]}: {r.importances_mean[i]:.3f} +/- {r.importances_std[i]:.3f} \n"
# Metric Logging: Custom Structure (Step 6)
aic_connection.set_custom_info(
    custom_info= [
        MetricCustomInfo(name= "Feature Importance (verbose)", value=  str(r)),
        MetricCustomInfo(name= "Feature Importance (brief)", value= feature_importances )
    ]
)
#
# Save model
import pickle
pickle.dump(clf, open(MODEL_PATH, 'wb'))
#
# Metric Logging: Tagging the execution (Step 7)
aic_connection.set_tags(
    tags= [
        MetricTag(name="Validation Method Used", value= "K-Fold"), # your custom name and value
        MetricTag(name="Metrics", value= "R2")
    ]
)

entry.title: Re: How to adjust the tax amount for Japanese yen sales o...
entry.content:
Hi @omega-ou 

Thank you for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Japanese Yen does not have decimal places in SAP, so all calculations round to the nearest whole number. The calculation of tax such as 10% VAT may lead to fractional values, which SAP standardly rounds either up, down, or standard based on the system and tax code configuration. This sometimes causes discrepancies between the legally expected tax per Japanese tax requirements and the system calculated value.

I advice you consider doing the following:

  1. Tax rounding in SAP for Japanese scenarios can be controlled through specific routines and VAT code settings. In the SAP configuration, you can select rounding rules for each VAT code: standard (round to nearest), round up, or round down. These settings are typically found in the tax code using transaction OBYZ or VAT customization, depending on release and localization settings.
  2. Make sure you use routines like 16 and 17 (In case you want to discount condition type, you need to give Routine 16 in the Alt. Cal. Type and also add Routine 17 in your Pricing Procedure) to influence rounding, which is available in pricing procedure configuration (V/08). For JPY, the system should use these routines to match rounding at the whole yen.
  3. You can configure decimals for JPY in table TCURX or via transaction OY04 for currency decimals (For this go to T.Code oy04, select the currency JPY and maintain the required decimals there). For Japan, you should set the decimal to 0, and all values should be rounded by SAP accordingly.
  4. Finally, you do have the possibility to manually override the rule. If strict legal compliance is required and discrepancies persist, SAP typically expects the system settings to reflect required rounding. Manual tax adjustment lines or post-processing adjustments may be required for occasional exceptions, though note that this is less common and less automated.

Below reference provide further details.

Rounding control in system setting (table TCURX/OY04)

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP CPQ Subscription to Events - Testing with External Webhook Application
entry.content:
SAP CPQ supports subscription to events, allowing developers to react to changes in real-time. This blog explores how CPQ developers can leverage external webhook applications to test and validate these event subscriptions effectively.

 

What Are SAP CPQ Event Subscriptions?

SAP CPQ allows developers to subscribe to specific system events—such as quote creation, approval, or status changes. When these events occur, CPQ sends a payload to a designated webhook URL, enabling external systems to respond accordingly.

This is particularly useful for:

  • Triggering workflows in external systems (e.g., SAP BTP, CPI or Integration Suite, CRM, ERP, S4 HANA)
  • Logging and auditing activities
  • Real-time notifications and alerts
  • Data synchronization across platforms

Why Test with an External Webhook Application?

Before deploying event subscriptions in production environment, it's crucial to test the payloads, headers, and response handling. External webhook applications provide a sandbox environment to:

  • Inspect incoming requests
  • Validate payload structure
  • Simulate response codes
  • Debug integration issues

Popular tools include:

  • Webhook.site
  • RequestBin
  • Beeceptor

Step-by-Step: Testing SAP CPQ Event Subscription

1. Create a Webhook Endpoint

Use a tool like Webhook.site to generate a unique URL. This will act as your temporary endpoint to receive event payloads.

2. Configure Event Subscription in SAP CPQ

Navigate to:

CPQ Admin → Providers → Subscriptions to Events - Create
  • Choose the event (e.g., Quote Created)
  • Paste your webhook URL
  • Set headers if needed (e.g., Authorization tokens)

3. Trigger the Event

Perform the action in CPQ that should trigger the event (e.g., create a new quote).

4. Inspect the Payload

Go back to your webhook tool and inspect:

  • HTTP method (usually POST)
  • Headers (Content-Type, Authorization)
  • JSON payload (quote ID, user info, timestamp, etc.)

5. Validate and Iterate

Check if the payload matches your expectations. You can simulate different responses (e.g., 200 OK, 500 Internal Server Error) to test CPQ’s retry logic and error handling.

Best Practices

  • Use descriptive event names for clarity.
  • Secure your webhook endpoints with tokens or IP whitelisting.
  • Log all incoming requests for audit and debugging.
  • Implement retry logic in case of failed deliveries.

Real-World Use Case

Imagine a scenario where a quote approval in CPQ should trigger a Iflow in SAP BTP Process Automation. By subscribing to the "Quote Status Changed" event and sending the payload to a webhook that initiates the workflow, you create a seamless, automated process—without manual intervention.

SAP Standard Integration Package (SAP Event Mesh Strategy- Available for S/4 HANA Public Cloud & BRIM)

AMQP is the protocol used by the adapter to receive events from SAP CPQ, utilizing the updated SAP Event Mesh Webhook URL available in SAP standard integration packages.

Go to CPQ Admin Setup - Providers - Subscription to Events - Create Event (as shown below)

Final Thoughts

Event subscriptions in SAP CPQ open up a world of possibilities for real-time integrations. By testing with external webhook applications, developers can ensure their systems are robust, secure, and responsive. Whether you're building a simple notification system or a complex multi-platform workflow, this approach is a game-changer.

Glossary

  • AMQP (Advanced Message Queuing Protocol) is a messaging protocol, not an adapter itself.
  • The adapter (e.g., SAP Event Mesh or a middleware like SAP Integration Suite) uses AMQP to handle event-driven communication.
  • The Webhook URL is part of the configuration that allows SAP CPQ to send event data to SAP Event Mesh.
  • SAP standard packages refer to pre-configured integration content available in SAP Integration Suite or API Business Hub.

entry.title: Re: FM for inbound delivery creation
entry.content: @sudheerkumar_neerati The function modules BBP_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE_31I and BBP_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE are part of the SAP Business Warehouse (BW) component. They are intended for data replication and integration between the core SAP system and the BW system. They do not perform the same logistics execution tasks as standard LE transactions (VL31N) or BAPIs (BAPI_INB_DELIVERY_CREATE). Using them to create a delivery for a standard MM purchase order will result in errors, no action, or the creation of an incorrect object in the wrong system context

entry.title: Re: no permissions to create and activate the SSCUI - 105...
entry.content:
Hello @Sanjay_Sota2024 

For SSCUI 105518 – Activate Document and Reporting Compliance Features, this is not an authorisation issue. Even if you assign the role SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT with unrestricted write access, as mentioned in SAP Note 2752164

This restriction is by design. The activation of Document and Reporting Compliance must be performed in Central Business Configuration (CBC) by SAP. Customers cannot execute this SSCUI directly.

SAP KBA– 2752164 - Error "No change authorisation. Editing not possible" while trying to edit an SSCUI

SAP Help Portal – Document and Reporting Compliance in SAP S/4HANA Cloud

SAP Central Business Configuration – Overview

If it doesn't work, I suggest raising an incident in SAP for me under component LOD-BC-CBC-S4C (Central Business Configuration), asking SAP to enable the compliance features for your required country/region.

Feel free to reach out if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: RA keys
entry.content:
Hello @AIsmail 

My apologies for the delayed reply, and thank you for following up. You have asked a good question. Please note that although RA Keys and RA Versions are pre-delivered and cannot be configured in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP provides documentation explaining their logic and use cases.

The list of available RA Keys and their behaviour is detailed in the official SAP Help for Event-Based Revenue Recognition (Scope Item 3EJ).

 SAP Learning – Event-Based Revenue Recognition (3EJ)

For a clearer understanding of the valuation logic behind RA Versions and RA Keys, see the “Revenue Recognition Methods” section in the same documentation. It explains when the system recommends each key as a completed contract, cost-based POC, or time-based.

You can also view the assigned RA Key in the Manage Project Settings app (for projects) or in Manage Customer Projects when revenue recognition is activated.

Let me know if you work

Best regards,
Chuma

entry.title: Finding SAP Note using AI
entry.content:
The Challenge Every Basis Administrator Knows

If you’ve worked in SAP Basis, you know the scenario well:
A transport fails, a short dump appears in ST22, or a background job terminates.

The next step? Hunting through SAP Notes in the Launchpad.

This process is often:

  • Time-consuming, with hundreds of possible Notes.

  • Keyword-driven, meaning you need to guess the right search terms.

  • Trial-and-error, as many Notes don’t exactly match the error in your system.

The result is hours of lost productivity, delayed fixes, and frustrated teams.

Today’s SAP Notes search is powerful, but it depends heavily on manual filtering. Notes can be technical, fragmented, or reference outdated versions of components. Even experienced Basis administrators often spend too much time narrowing down the “right” Note.

At the same time, SAP landscapes are becoming more complex, spanning S/4HANA, cloud integrations, DB migrations, and hybrid infrastructures. This complexity only increases the challenge of quickly mapping system errors to the correct Note.

Where AI Can Make a Difference

This is where Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) can transform the way we work with SAP Notes.

Imagine a system that could:

  • Read your error log automatically (from ST22, SM21, STMS, or job logs).

  • Understand the context of the error beyond keywords (e.g., system version, module, DB type).

  • Recommend the top 3 SAP Notes most relevant to fixing that exact error.

  • Learn from history. If a Note solved the issue for your team in the past, it would prioritize that next time.

This would save Basis teams valuable hours, reduce downtime, and make troubleshooting far more efficient.

How It Could Work in Practice

  1. Log Capture: System errors, dumps, or transport logs are collected (e.g., via Solution Manager or Focused Run).

  2. AI/NLP Engine: An AI model trained on historical SAP error messages and Notes embeddings interprets the log text.

  3. Notes Recommendation: The system suggests a short, ranked list of relevant Notes.

  4. Feedback Loop: Administrators confirm whether the suggested Note fixed the issue, improving recommendations over time.

This approach transforms troubleshooting from manual search to AI-powered recommendation.

AI-powered Note recommendation is just the beginning. Over time, such a system could evolve into an intelligent assistant that:

  • Correlates SAP + OS + DB logs for cross-layer analysis.

  • Validates system refreshes and upgrades by comparing logs before and after.

  • Predicts risks in transports or background jobs before they fail.

This vision aligns with SAP’s own push toward intelligent operations and embedded AI, but with a strong focus on the Basis layer, where today much of the work is still manual.

Final Thoughts

By applying AI and NLP to SAP Notes, Basis teams can move from reactive troubleshooting to proactive, intelligent support.

This is an area where I believe there is huge potential for innovation, research, and where every Basis professional can benefit.

I’m exploring this further and would love to connect with others interested in AI + Basis.

entry.title: Re: ALV display : 'ZERO' object reference is not possible...

What causing the Dump is the fact that the column “ERRTYP” does not exist in the SALV metadata. So you’re trying to dereference a null reference.
You need to check if lv_colname is bound before calling the method set_short_text
